unitControlModule.stateFactories.actions.executableActions

Class TerranSiegeTank_TankMode_MoveIntoExpectedSiegeRange

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaGOAP.GoapAction
      • unitControlModule.stateFactories.actions.executableActions.BaseAction
        • unitControlModule.stateFactories.actions.executableActions.TerranSiegeTank_TankMode_MoveIntoExpectedSiegeRange
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GroupableAction

    public class TerranSiegeTank_TankMode_MoveIntoExpectedSiegeRange
extends BaseAction
    TerranSiegeTank_TankMode_MoveIntoExpectedSiegeRange.java --- Action for a PlayerUnitTerran_SiegeTank to move into bombard / siege range of an expected enemy Unit, therefore preparing itself for an incoming attack. Preparing is better than simply reacting to enemies since morphing the tank from Tank_Mode into Siege_Mode takes time. For this Action to be performable the Unit has to be completely out of range of the enemy Unit (-> No Unit in siege range / below siege range), therefore limiting it's use cases.
    Author:
    P H - 27.10.2017

      • generatePossiblePositionIndex

        private java.lang.Integer generatePossiblePositionIndex(java.util.List<bwapi.TilePosition> path)
        Function for finding a suitable index at which the Terran_Siege_Tank could move to in order to be at a certain distance to the enemy Unit as well as on the path that it would have to take to move towards the Player's starting location.
        Parameters:
        path - the List of TilePositions the enemy Unit has to follow in order to get to the Player's starting location (Emerging from the enemy Unit).
        Returns:
        the index of a TilePosition of the provided List (Emerging from the enemy Unit) which the Unit could move to.

      • tryGeneratingPossibleMovePosition

        private bwapi.Position tryGeneratingPossibleMovePosition(java.util.List<bwapi.TilePosition> path,
                                                         java.lang.Integer possiblePositionIndex)
        Function for generating a Position that the executing Unit can move to in order to be prepared for an enemy attack. This function utilizes various Vector operations to ensure that the generated Position is indeed the shortest, free TilePosition the Unit can move to.
        Parameters:
        path - the List of TilePositions the enemy Unit has to follow in order to get to the Player's starting location (Emerging from the enemy Unit).
        possiblePositionIndex - the index of a TilePosition of the provided List (Emerging from the enemy Unit) which the Unit could move to.
        Returns:
        a Position the Unit can move to without interfering with any other Units that might be blocking a generated TilePosition.

      • generatePathVector

        private Vector generatePathVector(java.util.List<bwapi.TilePosition> path,
                                  int possiblePositionIndex)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Function for generating a Vector from a TilePosition on a provided Path to a TilePosition with a larger index. This is used to provide a general direction Vector that can be used for calculating the estimated direction the enemy Unit will have to move in order to reach the Player's starting location. The provided index is the start of the generated Vector while a desired offset defines the number of TilePositions that are skipped before generating the Vector's end-Position.
        Parameters:
        path - the List of TilePositions the enemy Unit has to follow in order to get to the Player's starting location (Emerging from the enemy Unit).
        possiblePositionIndex - the index of a TilePosition of the provided List (Emerging from the enemy Unit) which the Unit could move to.
        Returns:
        a Vector that describes the general direction the enemy Unit has to move in order to reach the Player's starting location using a path and a starting index (+ offset).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - throws a basic Exception when the offset that is applied to the TilePosition on the provided path is smaller than 1. If this occurs no Vector can be generated since the start-Position would be equal to the end-Position (=> Point!).

      • generateBoundaryIntersections

        private bwapi.Pair<bwapi.Position,bwapi.Position> generateBoundaryIntersections(Vector pathVector)
        Function for creating two Vectors to intersect the map's / current Region's boundaries. The length can be set to any value as long as the boundaries of the start Position are intersected. Both Vectors are rotated left and right by a fixed amount.
        Parameters:
        pathVector - a Vector that describes the general direction the enemy Unit has to move in order to reach the Player's starting location.
        Returns:
        the Pair of Positions that the generated Vectors, which got rotated left and right by X-degrees, are intersecting the map's / current Region's boundaries.

        Function for extracting the first free / non occupied TilePosition from a List of TilePositions.
        Parameters:
        pathToIntersection - the List of TilePosition that is going to be looked at.
        Returns:
        the first occurrence of a TilePosition for which the test "getUnitsOnTile()" returns true.

        private bwapi.TilePosition findCloserTilePosition(bwapi.TilePosition freeTilePositionLeft,

        Function for finding the closest TilePosition of a pair of two provided TilePositions to the currently executing Unit.
        Parameters:
        freeTilePositionLeft - the first TilePosition that is going to be checked.
        freeTilePositionRight - the second TilePosition that is going to be checked.
        Returns:
        the TilePosition of the provided ones that is closest to the executing Unit.
